Information expansion "Chinese character set for encoded characters.
This document specifies the Chinese graphical characters and binary codes used in information technology, and the hexadecimal representations thereof.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input, and output of Chinese and other graphical character and symbol information.

This document applies to technical products that have the functions of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other characters, graphics, and symbols, including but not limited to software products that include input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, speech synthesis, handwriting recognition, and e-book reading devices, as well as portable devices such as computers, communication terminal devices, and electronic reading devices.

Four word compound
Summary 4.1
The characters in this document are encoded in single-character blocks, double-character blocks, or four-character blocks.
The character segments of the single character code include all 128 characters from GB11383-1989 from 0x00 to 0x7F.
4.3 Double-digit part
The double-byte portion includes all graphic characters in GB2312-1980 and the CJK uniform Chinese characters in GB13000, as well as some graphic characters.
The characters in the double-byte part are defined according to Appendix A.
In particular, the graphical, coding and functional characteristics of the graphical symbols used to describe phonemes should comply with the requirements of Appendix B.
GB13000 is a uniform code for Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese, and other countries and regions using Chinese characters.

Chinese characters with unique abstract characters forms are assigned individual code positions; Chinese characters with the same abstract characters forms but different origins are assigned shared code positions.
Coded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.

General structure:
In the main text, numbers preceded by 0x indicate the use of hexadecimal, while those without 0x indicate the use of decimal.
All codes indicated in the Appendix are expressed in hexadecimal notation, while all other numbers are expressed in decimal notation.
The character part uses the coding structure of GB11383 Part 1, 1989, using the code positions from 0x00 to 0x7F.

The double-byte kangbu consists of two eight-bit binary codes that represent a character. The first character position code starts from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the second character position code is 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.

The four-character segment uses the extensions 0x30 to 0x39, which were not used in GB11383-1989, as the suffix for the extension of the double-character segment, covering the range 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both process one or more input files in four steps: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, and linking.
The postfix designates the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the postfix controls the default setting:
gcc considers the preprocessed files (.i) to be C files, and sets up C-style connections.
g++ considers the preprocessed files (.i) to be C++ files, and sets up C++-style connections.
The suffix of the source file indicates the language type and the post-processing operations:

The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the drug market
Its impact may be similar to the economic crisis of 2008.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has put the entire world in an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has overwhelmed the medical service facilities, which are close to collapse, and the restrictions implemented by the governments have caused serious disruption in the global economy.
The impact of the epidemic on the drug market is still unclear, and it is difficult to predict, but it may have far-reaching consequences.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to make drugs, as the restrictions on movement also limit the access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Smugglers are unable to cross the border due to travel restrictions, and may therefore have to find new routes and methods.
The patterns of drug use and supply may change, and the government's response capacity may also be hindered.
The changes brought about by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but some lessons can still be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began seeking cheaper synthetic substances, and their use patterns shifted towards injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments in various countries have reduced their budgets related to drugs.

If governments in all countries respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, preventive measures against drug use and related risky behaviors, as well as drug treatment services, may be severely affected.
Furthermore, the priority of interception operations and international cooperation may be lowered, making smugglers more mobile.
Some countries have a large amount of narcotics smuggled in through commercial flights, and it is expected that these countries' drug trafficking activities are most directly affected by this.

Messengers may carry amphetamine or other synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine in their carry-on bags or checked luggage, sometimes in large quantities. Due to the restrictions on airline passenger transport almost everywhere, the supply of drugs through commercial air travel may be completely disrupted.
Although the international postal supply chain is also affected, the use of the darknet and parcel delivery for trafficking activities may increase.
From a long-term perspective, economic recession and related closure measures may disrupt the drug market.

Due to the rising unemployment rate and the lack of opportunities, the poor and vulnerable groups are more likely to use drugs in a harmful way, contract drug diseases, and turn to drug-related illegal activities, regardless of whether they are involved in production or transportation.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of this situation and offer services to vulnerable groups, recruiting new members to grow their ranks.
As the government's response capabilities decline, these changes may quickly take root, becoming a new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Market growth
Population growth models partly explain the reason for market expansion.
The prevalence of drug use has been increasing worldwide, regardless of whether we look at the overall numbers or the percentage of drug users in the world population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64 years. In 2018, it was estimated that there were 269 million drug users, accounting for 5.3% of this population.
In the past twenty years, the growth rate of drug use in developing countries has been far higher than in developed countries.

To a certain extent, this reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, with developed countries growing by 7%, and developing countries by 28%, but also reflects the faster population growth of young people in developing countries.
Teenagers and young adults make up the largest proportion of drug users.
During the period 2000-2018, the population of the age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while the population of the age group in developed countries decreased by 10%.
One of the drivers of the current and future drug markets is urbanization.
Regardless of whether it is a developed country or a developing country, the drug abuse situation in urban areas is higher than in rural areas.

Part of the overall increase in drug use is due to the large-scale migration of the population from rural areas to urban areas. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, and in 1960 this proportion was 34%.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, especially in developing countries where the trend toward urbanization is more pronounced.

The increase in wealth is associated with an increase in drug use, but the most burdened by disease are the poorest people in the world, and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries.
Illicit drugs such as heroin are more closely linked to the more affluent regions of the world.
Similarly, within each country, the prevalence of drug abuse among the affluent social classes is higher.
However, the proportion of those with drug addiction symptoms is higher among people with a lower social and economic status.
Data from a few countries indicates that there is a connection between harmful drug patterns and illnesses and low incomes.
These patterns seem to be less common in more affluent social strata.
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 crisis could exacerbate the risks faced by vulnerable groups, including drug users, in particular.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as unemployment rising, have always been associated with an increase in drug use, and this pandemic has already forced hundreds of millions of people around the world to lose their jobs.

The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to the further expansion of the drug market. The widespread outbreak of COVID-19 may lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in the cultivation of illegal crops, or because of the reduced control capabilities of national regulatory authorities, or because of the increased number of people who may have to resort to criminal activities in an economic crisis.

The related restrictions on the new coronavirus have led to a reduction in air and land traffic, and it is possible that maritime smuggling has increased as a result. The risk of interception at sea is low, and there are more smuggled goods at sea than in the air or on land.
Recently, reports have surfaced that cocaine goods can be directly shipped from South America via sea routes to Europe.
Complexity enhancement

The appearance of non-internationally controlled substances is stable, but new, potentially harmful, synthetic cannabinoids are increasing. The drug market is becoming more complex, with new threats emerging.
In addition to cannabis, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added, many of which are not under international control. The non-medical use of drugs is also rapidly increasing.
There are approximately 500 new active ingredients on the domestic markets of member countries each year.
Currently, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
Although the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
Among the total number of new psychoactive substances confirmed in 2014, the opioid-like new psychoactive substances account for only 2%, but this figure has increased to 9% by 2018.

Many of the new psychoactive substances in the class of opioids are similar to fentanyl, and their effects and dangers have been proven. They have caused overdose deaths in North America, but also in other regions, but to a lesser extent.
In North America, fenanyl is used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine), and is also used to produce counterfeit opioid medications.

Some evidence suggests that Europe also has the injection of new psychoactive substances excitation drugs: A study of residues left behind in six European cities found that many of the syringes contained new psychoactive substances that produce an exciting effect.
The use of new psychoactive substances may gradually become a permanent feature in the weakest groups.
Single-class new psychoactive substances have rarely formed a large market.
However, evidence from Europe indicates that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem in marginalized groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
Twenty-two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most countries identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

Controls on precursors to synthetic drugs have forced drug makers to innovate, and many chemicals used to synthesize amphetamine, methamphetamine, and "speed" have been placed under international control.

Drug dealers and manufacturers are always looking for alternative substances, not only those with less stringent controls, but also specialized chemicals designed to circumvent controls, i.e. so-called "precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 are likely to put further pressure on the manufacturers of precursor chemicals, who rely on them.

Evidence from Mexico indicates that this is already a reality: According to a report, in March 2020, a shortage of methylamine precursors imported from East Asia led to a price increase for methylamine in Mexico and the United States.
The market is ever-changing.
Synthetic drugs have replaced opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation.
The opioid market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.

The number of opioids intercepted by Russian federal authorities has decreased by about 80%, while the number of people receiving treatment for the use of synthetic opiates has decreased significantly.
However, the market for stimulants seems to be growing increasingly vigorous.
Evidence suggests that methylenedioxypyrophenone (MDPV) and various ketamines, including dextromethorphan and a-p-methylphenethyl ketone, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.

Russian authorities reported that the number of secret production sites for the manufacture of various illegal drugs recently uncovered has risen sharply, and in two years has increased by more than one hundredfold, reaching 152 sites in 2018.
The markets for methylphenylisopropylamine in Afghanistan and Iraq have grown.
The investigation into the importance of methylphenidate in Iraq, conducted as early as 2012, revealed its importance for medical personnel, prisons and other institutions.
Crystalline methylphenidate has become another major concern besides fenfluramine and dexfenfluramine.
A study conducted in 2015 further confirmed these findings, with drug users stating that marijuana was harder to obtain than "fenetyl" or methylphenethylamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methylphenidate processing points, and the Narcotics Bureau has expressed concern about the large import of fake methylphenidate products. Methylphenidate processing points use these products as precursors.
In Afghanistan, the manufacture of methylphenidate appears to have begun in 2014.
Since then, the seizure volume of methylphenidate has been steadily increasing.
But the amount of seizures in the first half of 2019 was 657 kg—an increase of more than 100% compared to the previous year.
In other countries, large quantities of methamphetamine believed to originate from Afghanistan have been seized, which also indicates that the country's production is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends of change
Most legalized areas for non-medical marijuana use show an upward trend in marijuana use.
In Canada, Uruguay, and the United States, 11 regions allow the production of marijuana products for non-medical use.

In most cannabis-legal jurisdictions, the use of cannabis has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical cannabis use.

In the two US states where legislation was passed earliest, Colorado and Washington, the use of marijuana for non-medical purposes by adults has increased, especially in the past month and in cases where it is used daily or almost daily, exceeding the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, marijuana use in Uruguay has increased, and last month it almost doubled.
This indicates that the main reason for the increase is frequent and frequent use of marijuana.
The short-term data from Canada also indicates that the legal market expanded during the period from 2018 to 2019 while usage also increased.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products through illegal sources.
The reason behind the sharp drop in the worldwide cannabis crop seizures is the legalization of marijuana?
In 2018, the worldwide cannabis plant seizures fell to their lowest level in 20 years, due to a decrease in seizures in North America, which has decreased by 84% in the past 10 years.

By comparison, the seizure volume in other parts of the world during the same period was almost doubled. The seizure patterns indicate that the policy aimed at liberalizing the marijuana market has played a key role in the decline.
The regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have a deterrent effect, and it is difficult to assess the effectiveness of the domestic regulation of new psychoactive substances.
Some countries that apply different regulatory regimes to new psychoactive substances show different prevalence rates for new psychoactive substances.
In other countries, after new psychoactive substances were introduced through national legislation, the use of these substances has decreased.

Weakened groups face the harm from both legal and illegal drug markets in terms of pain management and palliative treatment, mainly in high-income countries. Painkillers based on opioid-type pharmaceuticals are unevenly distributed in different regions.
In 2018, over 90% of all opioid medicines available for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
The population of these countries accounts for about 12% of the world's population.
According to estimates, the population of low- and middle-income countries makes up 88% of the world's population, but only 9% of the population consumes opioid drugs for medical purposes.
Obtaining medicinal opioids is a challenge that is related to many factors, including legislation, culture, the healthcare system, and prescription practices.
People who are poorer are at greater risk of developing drug abuse symptoms. Approximately 35.6 million people suffered from drug abuse symptoms in 2018.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of drug abuse and exacerbate its consequences. This has been confirmed by research in high-income countries, in which individual's adverse socioeconomic trajectories are not only associated with their situation at a given point in time, but also with the risk of drug abuse.

Drug abuse symptoms also deepen social and economic disadvantages, further increasing the risks of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thus fostering a vicious cycle of disadvantage. These results may also be related to degrading attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, indigenous peoples and migrants, sexual minorities, people displaced due to armed conflict or disasters, and people living in rural areas may also be disproportionately affected by drug addiction symptoms, or encounter problems in accessing treatment services.

According to the disability-adjusted life-year (DALY) indicator for years of healthy life lost due to disability and premature death, the adverse effects of addiction on a wider range of societies have intensified over the past 10 years.
Between 2007 and 2018, the global disability-adjusted life expectancy due to drug use increased by 17%.
In the injecting drug users, the liver cancer-related disability adjusted life years caused by untreated hepatitis B is particularly high—up to 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is complex and difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychotropic substances and violence.
Limited data from around the world indicates that intoxication may be a major factor in murder.
However, in violent incidents, alcohol seems to have a greater impact than drugs.

Although drug abuse may lead to crime, in some cases, this link can partly be attributed to a variety of intermediary factors, such as social and economic disadvantages, as well as other types of adversity caused by individual risk factors, family environment, and peer pressure.
The connection between drug dealing and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including international drug trafficking, large-scale organized crime activities may be implemented without violence.

In the short term, the level and prevalence of violence depends less on the number of shipments and more on certain changes in the balance of power between organized crime groups, such as the change in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of well-known criminals, and the enforcement measures that make one group weaker than another.
The latest trend
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and opioids are the most harmful.
According to estimates, 1.92 billion people used marijuana in 2018, making it the most widely used drug in the world.
By comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
However, the related risks of opioid drugs are often ignored due to their relatively low use.

In the estimated 167,000 deaths in 2017 related to drug abuse, 66% were caused by these substances, and in the 210 million years of lost life attributed to disabilities or premature death caused by drug abuse, 50% were caused by these substances.
The non-medical use of synthetic opioids has exacerbated the public health crisis.

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the aggravation of the opioid crisis by ketamine is most significant; in North America, it is fentanyl. These regions have few commonalities in terms of economic, demographic, or drug use statistics, but they are all struggling to combat the opioid crisis fueled by easily accessible and inexpensive substances.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to an increase in the number of overdose deaths involving opioids over the past 20 years.
In the 67,367 cases of excess deaths registered in the United States in 2018, 60% involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Part of the reason for the overdose deaths caused by fentanyl in the illegal drug market is that the effects of fentanyl are unpredictable.
In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the market for veterinary-use Cumarine has grown significantly.
In this area, the number of patients with the disease is increasing, and the patients who are being treated are using it more and more.
In 2017, the global seizure of QUAMOX significantly increased, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
However, after a new law on controlling the use of antibiotics was passed in India in 2018, the global seizure volume dropped to 32 tons.

The crisis in these two regions is caused by the production of simple products and low production costs, in addition to the lack of international supervision for compounds similar to quinine or its precursors.
These substances are available in both the legal and illegal markets, which makes it more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse. As a result, the crisis in these two locations has worsened.
The use of stimulants is on the rise.
The cocaine and methamphetamine markets are the mainstays of the stimulant industry, and both substances are being used more in their major markets.
Approximately 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, because cocaine is quite popular in North America and Western Europe.
About 27 million people used phenylpropanolamine in 2018, with methylphenylpropanolamine being the most commonly used phenylpropanolamine-type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to the majority of indicators that we have access to, the use of methylphenidate in these two areas has been expanding over the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes substituting for each other, and the use of one drug increases the use of the other, sometimes at the same time. This is to meet the needs of the same market.
The risk of injecting drug users has increased due to the new coronavirus pneumonia.
According to estimates, about 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018, and about 10% of the world's HIV infections were caused by injection drug use.
More than 10 million people have contracted HIV through injections, and 5.5 million people have hepatitis B.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died from drug overdoses, of which half died from liver disease caused by hepatitis B, and treatment for hepatitis B in drug injectors is still lacking in most cases.
The shortage of opioids caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead users to use alcohol or phenothiazines, which are easier to obtain, or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs.
With some users switching to injections or more frequent injections, there may be more harmful ways of using the drug.

EU summit debates refugee policy, EU officials: the process of receiving refugees is full of bottlenecks - China News
EU summit debates refugee policy endlessly, EU officials: The process of accepting refugees has bottlenecks at every stage

According to a report by AFP on February 10, at the latest EU summit held on that day, European Commission President Juncker said that the EU leaders agreed to issue more stringent policies on illegal immigration to make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.

According to reports, the EU's move is a response to the increasingly serious illegal immigration problem in Europe, and now the EU's core issue is that the number of illegal immigrants that can ultimately be deported is very small.

According to the conference documents, the EU leaders called on the Commission "to immediately mobilize large amounts of EU funds" to strengthen the external borders through infrastructure and surveillance measures.
However, the EU and its member states have been embroiled in disputes over the cost of fencing and other issues.
Fender Reine repeatedly stated that EU funds would not cover the related costs.

However, some member states' diplomatic officials claim that if the EU could share the burden of installing cameras, observation towers, and other infrastructure along the external border line, this would free up national budgets, thus accelerating the construction process.

The European Euractiv website reported that EU officials admitted that the refugee reception process at every step is stalled, and that the limited reception capacity and overburdened migration authorities of member states cannot prevent refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in EU member states. The EU's refugee reception system is in a state of near-permanent crisis.

According to an estimate by the European Commission, the Schengen countries of the EU received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly half compared to the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded over 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.

In this context, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle," namely that EU member states can deport illegal immigrants to their home countries based on a court ruling from another member state.
Additionally, it is reported that EU leaders have also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of security countries", which will open the way for the EU to form a common list.
Source: Global Times, author: Niu Ruifeng
The United States upgraded the "semiconductor war" and severely damaged the global semiconductor industry - China News Network

Recently, the "chip war" between the United States and China has been upgraded to a new level— first, under the pressure from the United States, the Netherlands and Japan agreed to implement the export control of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China; later, foreign media reported that the United States government is considering cutting off all contacts between U.S. suppliers and Huawei; and, the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an executive order to restrict

In recent years, the United States has never ceased its efforts to suppress China's "chips" development, on the one hand, it has accurately suppressed the Chinese semiconductor supply chain, and on the other hand, it has built a "de-Chinaization" semiconductor industrial chain alliance with the aim of completely "outdistancing" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to form a "technology alliance" with South Korea to build a semiconductor "technology alliance", or to form a "semiconductor alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and China's Taiwan region, or to establish a semiconductor "four-way alliance" through the "four-way mechanism" and the "Indo-Pacific economic framework" of the United States, the United States has attempted to introduce
However, the “semiconductor strategy” of the United States, which is being heavily promoted, is also “a thousand cuts for the enemy, eight hundred for oneself”.

Recently, the US-based semiconductor manufacturing equipment supplier Lam Research Group announced that the company would lay off 1,300 full-time employees due to the latest round of export restrictions on semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China, and that it also planned to lay off 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters.

The world's largest lithography machine manufacturer, ASML Holding NV of the Netherlands, recently warned that the prohibition of exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China could lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

US media analyzed that after the US government's ruthless crackdown on the semiconductor and other industries, many US companies suffered greatly, including semiconductor design automation tool developers, chip designers, chip manufacturing equipment manufacturers, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The so-called pressure by the United States on China's advanced semiconductor industry is actually dragging down the entire semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry that has already formed a tightly connected global semiconductor industry chain.

According to the estimates of experts, the entire production process of semiconductor products requires crossing the borders of various countries more than 70 times based on specialization of labor, and the entire process takes about 100 days.

Although the semiconductor industry in the United States has a solid foundation, it is weak in terms of manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced manufacturing processes, and relies heavily on the East Asian region.

Even though the United States has been actively encouraging the advanced chip supply chain to shift towards the “small circles” that are under U.S. leadership, the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor-related industries are difficult to change.
The United States has "reformed" and "de-Chineseized" the semiconductor industry chain in a powerful manner, and has dealt a severe blow to the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future industries around the world. The development of the chip industry cannot be achieved without the participation of all countries around the world.

Over the past few years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively promulgating the "Innovation and Competition Act", the "2022 U.S. Competition Act", and the "Chip and Science Act", using its technological hegemony to consolidate its technological leadership advantage; it has exercised its power in a "gracious and stern" manner to persuade companies such as Intel,
In the short term, the United States has indeed created problems for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, and has reaped real benefits.

But in the long run, the United States' hysterical suppression will force China's semiconductor industry to continuously break through, and in the end, the United States will lose a huge Chinese market. In the end, this will greatly weaken the innovation intent and innovation ability of U.S. technology companies, and damage the development of the global semiconductor industry.
Joey Guo
The first batch of individual retirement fund investment products went on sale. The shortest holding period is 360 days.
The first batch of individual retirement savings investment products went on sale.
The 7 products offered by family institutions can be selected, and the shortest holding period is as short as 360 days.
Personal pension investment products are finally available.

On February 10, China Asset Network released the first list of individual pension fund investment products. The 7 individual pension fund investment products of China Merchants Fund, Agricultural Bank Fund, and China Post Fund were officially launched by China Merchants Fund, Agricultural Bank Fund, and China Post Fund.

With this, the "shelves" of individual pension savings accounts have finally been filled with four types of products: individual pension savings deposits, individual pension savings investment, individual pension savings insurance, and individual pension savings publicly-traded funds.

According to the introduction, the first batch of individual pension savings investment products are all publicly-traded net asset value open-end funds. Of the newly launched products, there are 5, and the existing products have 2. Except for one mixed-asset product, the remaining 6 products are all fixed-income type products.

Beijing Youth Daily reporters saw that 5 of the newly launched products came from ICBC Wealth Management, all of which were fixed-income products, with the shortest holding period ranging from 365 days to 1080 days. The corresponding benchmarks for performance comparison (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4.60%, 4.4

The remaining new product is "Postal Bank Wealth & Wealth of Hong Kong: Hang Jing Bond 1095-day Minimum Holding", which is also a fixed-income product. It will be launched for subscription on February 10, and the subscription will end on February 19. The risk level is two-tier.

One of the surviving products is the agricultural bank wealth management "Nong'an Harmony - Intelligent" 360-day technology innovation fixed-income wealth management product, which has an investment nature of mixed, and a risk level of 3.

Another product that is still in operation is "Hongxin Investment of China Merchants Bank (12-month term)", a fixed-income type product that was launched for fundraising on December 30, 2019, and officially started operations on January 4, 2020. As of February 8, the cumulative net asset value is 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds Issued by the State Council Office," the investment scope of individual pension fund assets includes bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, publicly-traded funds, etc.

The first batch of individual retirement savings investment products was launched, marking that individual retirement savings investors can officially purchase investment products through their individual retirement savings funds through their individual retirement savings fund accounts.

In November last year, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the "Interim Provisions on the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Asset Management Companies", which regulated the management of individual pension business of commercial banks and asset management companies.

The regulations stipulate that participants can purchase individual retirement savings accounts, individual retirement savings investment products, individual retirement savings insurance products, and individual retirement savings publicly-traded fund products through their individual retirement savings fund accounts.

The Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the General Administration of State Taxation issued a notice to clarify that the personal pension system would be implemented in Beijing, Tianjin, and other 36 pilot cities and regions, including Hebei Jinzhou City and the Xiongan New Area, as well as Shanxi Jincheng City.
As of the end of 2022, there were 19.54 million participants in personal pension plans, 6.13 million payers, and total payments of RMB142 billion.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot only uploaded three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension mutual funds.
Now that personal pension investment products have come together, what should investors do?

The experts of ICBC Asset Management Product Development Department pointed out that compared with other personal pension products, the pilot-phase retirement products and personal pension products all have three distinctive features.
One is stability, risk management mechanisms are more robust, investment strategies and principles are more stable, and third-party independent custody is implemented by non-mother banks.

Secondly, the term is long-term. The term of the pilot phase of long-term care retirement products is all above 5 years. The next step is to issue individual long-term care retirement savings products. The minimum holding period should be 1 year, and the encouragement period should be 3 years or more.

The third is inclusiveness, the purchase threshold is low, and the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and in some cases as low as 0.01 yuan. The fees for custody and management are also more favorable.
Professionals point out that investors should choose based on the characteristics of the product and their risk tolerance.

Individual pension savings have the characteristics of a longer period, a higher interest rate, and a higher safety factor, which are suitable for people with a weak risk tolerance; individual pension insurance products focus on security, and are more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable returns; while individual pension savings and publicly-traded fund products do not guarantee principal and do not guarantee returns, they have a certain investment risk, but the

The fitness industry should overcome the trust crisis - China News Network
Is another large fitness center about to "go bust"?
Recently, the issue of member rights protection at the popular fitness institution, Zhongjian Fitness Club, has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members discovered that their stores were not operating normally, and later, rumors about the closure of the institution caused members to panic, resulting in the involvement of the public security and social security departments.

Finally, the relevant responsible persons of the institution stepped forward to respond, and promised to make efforts to protect the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the incident was finally settled.

Some individual fitness facilities have experienced operational problems at some of their branches, and have been temporarily closed. Consumers could have waited patiently for the problems to be resolved, but why is the first reaction of many members to the situation "something's not right"?
The fitness club member protection dispute behind the incident is a deep-seated problem in the industry's trust crisis.
Traditional gyms in China generally adopt a prepaid model, and the underlying logic of their development is to "make money from users who don't come."

By obtaining cash flow from pre-sale memberships, opening new stores continuously, it may seem that it can be repeated, but in fact, it is a case of hoarding food and grain, and it cannot form a stable profit model.
Negative news about the fitness industry frequently appears, and this seriously impacts consumers' confidence.
From a market perspective, of course, a fitness center is a good business with a bright future.
Although the fitness track is up and down, it has always attracted the attention of capital.
Data from multiple sources show that the heat in the fields of cultural consumption and others is constantly rising, and the market is continuing to recover.

With regard to the fitness market, as the standard of living of residents steadily improves, the concept of a healthy lifestyle has taken root in people's minds, and the fitness industry has a lot of potential for development.
The more favorable the situation is, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the quality of development.

However, some institutions are overly optimistic about the fitness market after the revival of consumer demand, and are just coming out of the crisis. They are calling for the expansion of the territory and the opening of new markets, and are pouring all of their financing into the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that, due to the impact of the epidemic, many institutions have withdrawn in recent years, and the industry is undergoing a rearrangement. For those enterprises with strong capabilities, this is an excellent opportunity to increase their acquisition efforts and reconfigure their layouts selectively.
However, in order for the fitness market to develop in a positive way and enter a healthy cycle, the industry must change its traditional business model and its operating strategy.
Only by solidly establishing consumer trust and a sense of security can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared to the new stores of Big Build, the fitness industry needs to focus on improving its services. High-quality development is needed to stabilize users.
First, you have to keep users by providing good service.

The gym belongs to the service industry, and its essence is to adhere to the principle of "user-centricity." In order to focus on improving the quality of services, the business focus should be placed on upgrading the services.
Secondly, we need to improve user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the popular Internet-based fitness gym model, which allows users to pay by the minute and select their own location.
At the same time, body data and sports data can be effectively used, and social needs can be met, thus achieving a complete service loop from online to offline.
Without private sales and without annual memberships, users' concerns about leaving fitness facilities have been reduced, and their trust has also been improved.
In addition, we should actively explore multiple business models.

Today, sports consumption has moved from a single service to a consumption scenario, and fitness clubs may become a new consumption gateway. In addition to fitness-related products such as sports nutrition and fitness equipment, there may be new profit points in the form of related products, such as fitness-related accessories, which will provide consumers with a more diverse choice.
Jing Tianqi

Several key indicators are declining, and Taiwan's economic performance at the beginning of the year is not good - China News Network

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (reporters Zhao Bo and Huang Yang) Exports have declined for five consecutive months, and the PMI for manufacturing purchasing managers has contracted for seven consecutive months. The consumer price index (CPI) has also seen the "three-digit" mark... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released economic data for January 2023.
Economic performance at the beginning of the year in Taiwan was poor, and the growth pressure was not small. Experts analyzed that this way.

According to the Finance Administration of the Taiwan authorities, the export volume of the Taiwan region in January this year was 31.51 billion US dollars, down by 21.2% year-on-year, and this is the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export volume of the 11 major export commodities compared to the same period last year showed a decline in all cases.
Rubber and its products, as well as optical instruments, fell the most, with declines of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Electronic components exported decreased by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decline in 11 years.
In particular, the annual decline in integrated circuits was 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.

The Director of the Statistics Department, Cai Minna, said that this indicated that the demand for consumer electronics was weakening and that the electronic industry was entering a correction period.
Statistical data show that the total exports and imports of Taiwan’s region fell in January, with the export surplus only reaching 2.34 billion US dollars, the lowest level in the past three years.

The Finance Administration Department of the Taiwanese government believes that global end-of-line demand has decreased, and the industry has adjusted inventory to suppress suppliers' purchase intent, and the export slump is short-term and hard to reverse. Taiwan's first-quarter export decline is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the release of the Taiwan Economic Research Institute, the PMI for Taiwan's manufacturing sector in January, adjusted for seasonal factors, was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from December, and in contraction for the seventh consecutive month.
In the economic monitoring system, PMI is set at 50% as the critical line, and a value above 50% indicates expansion, while a value below 50% indicates contraction.

In January, the five components of the Taiwan PMI index showed a contraction in new orders, production, and employment of labor, a decrease in the delivery time of suppliers, and a contraction in inventory.

All six industries returned a full PMI contraction, and they were ranked in order of contraction rate by industry, from the power and machinery industry (35.1%), the electronic and optical industry (35.2%), the chemical and biotechnology medical industry (39.2%), the basic raw material industry (42.4%), the transportation industry (42.6%), and the food and textile industry (4

On the price front, the “Main Board of Accounts” of the Taiwan authorities released the annual inflation rate of Taiwan in January at 3.04%, which has been surpassed again for the second time since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables has risen by 28.25%, setting a new high in 17 months.

The Special Committee Member of the “Main Financial Bureau” of Taiwan, Cao Zhigang, candidly admits that the price increase of vegetables is beyond expectations, excluding the Spring Festival factor, the average CPI in January and February should be close to 2.71% in December of last year, and inflation pressure is still present, and it is still at a high point.
Looking ahead to Taiwan's economy this year, based on reports from Taiwanese media including United Daily News and Yahoo Finance, experts are pessimistic.

Prof. Wu Da-ren of the Economics Department of the "Central University of China" analyzed that the decline in exports may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturers and the risk of defaulting on debts may rise.
At the same time, the decrease in orders led to the manufacturers reducing their labor costs, which affected the labor market and family economy, and in turn impacted consumer ability.

Chiu Tsa-seng, a research fellow at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved this year, and that demand continues to shrink. He predicts that the decline in Taiwan's exports will continue into the second half of the year.
Because Taiwan's economy relies on exports, it will be affected by the sluggish export performance, and its economic growth performance for the year will not be as good as last year.

According to the "2022 China Returning Overseas Talent Employment Survey Report" released by Xinhuanet on February 11 (hereinafter referred to as the "Report"), the number of graduates from Chinese universities in 2022 increased by 8.6% compared to the previous year, and the number of returning overseas students seeking employment reached a new high. In addition, the demand for overseas talent by

The report indicates that the number of overseas Chinese returning to seek employment in China has significantly increased since 2020, and the number of graduates returning to seek employment has increased.

The price of oral implant medical services in Henan Province has been standardized - China News Network
According to CCTV News, implantation of teeth is a popular choice for many toothless patients, but the high price of RMB 10,000 or more per tooth has deterred many patients from choosing it.
Since the implementation of fast-tracked planting tooth collection, the price of implant teeth has been reduced in various places.

From February 10 onwards, the target price for medical services for single conventional implant dentistry in Henan Province is 4300 yuan for the full price control process. The full price for single conventional implant dentistry should not exceed 97% of the target price.

Planting teeth refers to a method of tooth restoration that involves supporting and fixing the upper part of the tooth restoration in the bone tissue by means of the lower part of the structure implanted in the bone.

A reporter learned from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University that, in terms of a single conventional implant, the cost from implantation to the final repair is approximately RMB 16,700.
Patient He Yan: After the new policy was implemented, the doctor told me that, in my case, it would cost about 8,000 yuan, or less than 10,000 yuan, which is basically half the cost.

In addition to the existing project, the province also integrated and determined the prices of 15 dental implant medical services, including the implantation fee per tooth, and uniformly formulated the prices of provincial public medical institutions under the management of the provincial government and the medical insurance payment categories. The prices of 20 medical services, including the implantation of dental implants, were canceled or adjusted.

Li Yunjie, director of the Medical Pricing and Bidding Department of the Chengdu Medical Insurance Administration: the main beneficiaries are the four sides: one is the medical insurance, which will have less expenditure; the hospital's pressure will be reduced, and patients will be appropriately increased; the suppliers will get a market; and for the patients, the cost of implanting a tooth may be reduced by half or even more
Shenzhen: Building the world's first and most advanced city of extreme speed pioneers - China News Network

According to the WeChat public account of "Shenzhen Industry and Information", "Shenzhen Industry and Information Bureau", dated February 11, the Shenzhen Industry and Information Bureau recently issued the "Shenzhen City Action Plan for the Construction of the Super Speed Leader City".

It is proposed that by the end of 2023, super-high-speed, large-capacity, low-latency ultra-broadband networks will be built, and the target of "dual gigabit, full-fiber, 1-millisecond, and all-connected" network construction will be realized. This will help build a world-leading ultra-fast advanced city, and the first city in China.
The plan proposed to accelerate the upgrade of 10G fiber optic networks.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires a comprehensive improvement in the energy efficiency of 5G networks.
The research and development of the quality standards and criteria for 5G network service in Shenzhen, and the testing and evaluation of 5G networks, aim to improve the quality of 5G network service.

Support the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and locations, and build 10,000 5G base stations throughout the year. The average download speed in the city will reach 500 Mbps, and the average upload speed will reach 100 Mbps. The download speed in key areas will reach 1 Gbps, and the upload speed will reach 200 Mbps. The network speed and user experience will be
Build high-quality, city-level wireless local area networks.

Develop standards for wireless local area networks (WLAN) in public places and promote the upgrade of WLAN in areas with high concentrations of people and high demand for information consumption. Provide 1Gbps access capabilities.

Based on the "Shen i Net" public wireless LAN network, the city's unified authentication and management platform for all public wireless LANs has been built. The goal is to achieve "one-time authentication, seamless roaming, intelligent switching," and support the operation entities to include socially built APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities within the certification and management platform.
By the end of 2023, the total number of APs to be upgraded should not be less than 20,000.

In addition, the Plan also proposes the construction of a high-quality, full-fiber transport network, the construction of a multi-tiered computing capacity supply system, the acceleration of the construction of key communication network facilities, and the enhancement of Internet application service capabilities.
The plan clearly states that we will cooperate to build a smart sensor system.

Explore a model for building a city sensing terminal management system based on the "Open Horizon" operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, accelerate the construction of a city-level intelligent sensing platform, promote the interconnection and mutual exchange of the city-level IoT platform, and various professional IoT platforms in different fields, and build a network and data exchange between the city-level IoT platform and various specialized IoT platforms.

Expand the application of the Internet of Things in urban management, public services, public security, transportation, and other fields, and expand the collection channels of fixed sensors and intelligent networked vehicles, such as city roads, buildings, and public facilities, with mobile sensors.

By the end of 2023, the number of smart terminals for water, electricity, gas, and network sensing will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional intelligent poles will be built as demonstration projects.

The plan also mentions strengthening the integration application of satellite and ground communications, building the foundation infrastructure for low-altitude networks, and promoting the in-depth coverage of 5G networks in the sea.

At the same time, it is necessary to promote the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea, build an innovative development ecosystem for the industry, and support the holding of world-class events and activities.
(CN Biz News)
The e-commerce industry in China is experiencing "new variables," and how to achieve "content is king" when doing cross-border delivery?
CCTV News February 11: "New variables emerge in China's e-commerce industry, how to do "content is king" when delivering goods?"
Xia Bin, a reporter from CCTV News Finance,
" We entered the e-commerce market a bit late, but from the very beginning we realized that in order to stand out among the millions of stores, content is important.
Fang Fang, a "90后" girl from Guangdong, is now operating a health food shop on Douyin's e-commerce platform. She has helped a 30-year-old offline store "bloom" online.
Simulating the atmosphere of old Hong Kong films, combined with classic Cantonese songs, opening the Weibo account of @Fang Fang, the videos are stunning.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce event "Find Like-Minded People and Share Quality Content," Fangfang, as a representative of quality creators, was invited to attend and share her experience and insights in daily creation.

She said on the spot, "The carefully-edited video has attracted the attention of many netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my kitchen. They want to make delicious food with me, and my sales have opened up overnight.

Fang Fang's videos of making soup have made more people fall in love with the taste of "Old Guang's", and in a single live broadcast, up to 300,000 packets of healthy ingredients were sold, saving an old store on the brink of bankruptcy.
"No content, no e-commerce", as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stages of live-streamed e-commerce, live-streaming rooms often used discounts to attract users, and price advantages seemed to be the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, there have been many "superstars" with a high degree of influence, such as Layher Hong, Fan Jianxuan, and many lesser-known "masters" and merchants who have emerged in vertical specialized fields. They have continuously created high-quality content that fits their brand identity, thereby enhancing their long-term operating efficiency.

Gao Yaxuan, the head of operations for the influencer stars of Douyin e-commerce, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators monetized their content through Douyin e-commerce, and their content creation volume increased by 252%, and their total transaction volume also increased by more than 100%.
Behind these numbers, we can feel the vibrant, thriving author ecosystem that is growing and has a strong sense of life.
"Gao Yaqian said."

Beijing Normal University's Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform previously released the "ECHI Report on the Ecosystem Health of the E-commerce Industry," analyzing the importance of high-quality content from a data perspective in the current e-commerce industry. The report used an index to evaluate the content ecosystem of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the e-commerce industry content ecology health index ranking in the above report, TikTok e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked in the top five.

The report believes that the content ecology in the e-commerce industry is a comprehensive concept that integrates e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional content production) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integrating e-commerce with content. The value of content platforms increases with the increasing richness of consumption and promotion scenarios, and the possibility of e-commerce insertion

At the scene, Professor Yue Guoming, Dean of the School of Journalism and Communication at Beijing Normal University, and President of the China Media Economics and Management Professional Committee, gave an analysis and interpretation of the report.

He said that, from the perspective of content value, the e-commerce industry has already transitioned from the "accessibility of consumption" to the "consumer quality" stage, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content became the fundamental and handle for the new stage of e-commerce development, and PGC content such as paid content, professional knowledge, and KOL (key opinion leaders) began to become the standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking ahead to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Yu Guomin proposed two suggestions.

From the perspective of content structure enhancement, we should promote the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecosystem, establish positive content creation and management standards, and achieve a balance between the content ecosystem health index and dynamic equilibrium in the e-commerce industry.

Another one is from the external ecological perspective, which is to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value synergy and co-creation of the external environment.

The e-commerce industry still needs more support in terms of data and artificial intelligence to make more accurate predictions about its future development; in addition, it needs to provide merchants with more regulated and healthy growth spaces, and create a value-coordinated ecosystem of enterprises, users, products, and services to jointly create a healthy content ecosystem.

The Chinese rescue team has continued its rescue operations in Turkey and has rescued 4 people trapped in the incident - China News Network

China News Service, February 11 - According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team sent 3 action teams and 45 rescue team members to Turkey to rescue a trapped person. They rescued one person.
At the same time, two search and evaluation teams were sent out to evaluate and inspect the 15 buildings on Vodarash Street.

The rescue team will adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation of the disaster area and the rescue scene on the spot, and continue to carry out rescue work in a scientific manner.

The rescue team obtained information about rescue requests through various channels, including the embassy, local government, and United Nations rescue organizations, and verified them through various methods, such as online questioning and on-site search.
Introduce the current rescue environment and collapse of buildings, and carry out search and rescue operations together.

The team has also communicated with the rescue teams of Italy, the United Kingdom, Serbia, Slovakia, and Oman, and learned about the rescue work of the United Nations relief organization and the rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team support in accordance with the principle of "unified command, safety first", and strengthened the safety control at the rescue site in accordance with the principle of "safety first". They also strengthened the discipline requirements for rescue work and clearly stated the safety precautions.
Continue to operate the rotating standby and guard duty system, and strengthen the security management of the camp area.

Medical personnel from the rescue team provide daily health checks for team members, strengthen the medical protection of key personnel, and the entire rescue team is currently healthy. They are conducting disinfection in the camp area.

After the self-supporting camp was established, the members of the logistics support team collectively built 26 tents of 4 major types: command and communication, equipment storage, medical and sanitation, living and accommodation, and dog houses. They also provided more than 30 sets of rescue equipment.

(Deutschlandfunk Chinese Service) The Biden administration added six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the alleged spy balloon program to the blacklist on Friday (February 10).

The U.S. Department of Commerce stated that these five Chinese companies and one research institution helped modernize the Chinese military, especially in the aerospace and defense fields, including submarines and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting US technology exports.

The list is called the "entity list," and companies that are on it will not be able to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they receive special export licenses from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The companies listed on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjiang Space and Technology Co., Ltd., Institute 48 of the China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Liankong Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd. in Dongguan, Yingmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xianghang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Yingmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.

Before this, the White House indicated that it was considering making more comprehensive measures, "disclosure and processing" of China's surveillance activities that pose a greater threat to the national security of the United States.
The balloon incident further strained relations between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken canceled his planned visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down an air balloon, and the Chinese government made a serious diplomatic protest to the U.S. embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously disrupting and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to maintain stable Sino-U.S. relations.

From the existing debris evidence and information from the Chinese military's procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon had "direct ties to the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and was an approved supplier for the Chinese military.

Miao Ning, a spokesperson for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said at a press conference on Friday that the Chinese side has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position regarding an unexpected incident involving a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle entering U.S. airspace due to force majeure.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolutions passed by the US Congress are purely political manipulation and publicity stunts.
The Chinese side is strongly dissatisfied with this and firmly opposes it.

Matthew Axelrod, the Assistant Secretary of Commerce responsible for export enforcement, said, "Today's action demonstrates our collective efforts to uncover and prevent the use of Chinese spy balloons, which violated the airspace of the United States and 40 other countries.
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Tianhai Xianghang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said he was unaware of the sanctions and refused to comment further.
The Chinese embassy in the United States and has not yet issued a comment on these information.
(Reuters and others)

After several days have passed since earthquakes hit parts of Turkey and Syria, the hopes of finding survivors are growing faint, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday has brought immense joy to the search and rescue personnel.
According to a report by the Associated Press, the five-member family trapped under the rubble in the Nurdahaitep town in Gadjain-Tap province for five days and more was successfully rescued.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from a pile of rubble, and then found the father, but he insisted on being rescued first for his son and another daughter.
After they were all rescued, cheers erupted from the crowd.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaraş, in the harsh cold weather conditions, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were successfully rescued.
What day is it today?
—— The boy who was trapped under the ruins for 129 hours asked the rescuers who brought him back to the ground what they were doing to save him.
A man from Kharmanmarsh held a cat that had just been rescued.

Miraculous success stories in rescue operations have brought a ray of hope to the search and rescue efforts that were already in a desperate state, but at the same time, the number of people in distress is on the rise.

According to official statistics, the earthquake that occurred on Monday has already caused more than 2,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts have stated that a person can survive for more than one week after being trapped in a ruined city, the chances of finding more survivors have become increasingly dim.
Rescue personnel are still using infrared imaging devices to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
At the same time, the focus of the rescue work began to shift towards helping the survivors who urgently needed assistance.
UN officials: The disaster in this region is "once in a century"

The United Nations Deputy Secretary-General in charge of humanitarian affairs and the coordinator for emergency relief, Martin Griffiths, said at a press conference in Turkey that this earthquake was the "worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's post-disaster response as "unprecedented."

He also told Reuters reporters that he hoped to be able to provide the rescue efforts to the areas controlled by the Syrian government and the opposition, but also indicated that the situation was "not clear" regarding the matter.
The United Nations has pledged to provide an additional $25 million in relief aid to the earthquake-affected populations in Syria.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced a funding of $25 million for relief efforts in Turkey and Syria.
The most destructive earthquakes that have occurred worldwide over the past 60 years.
The Chilean Great Earthquake (1960)
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by humans occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with an earthquake magnitude of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, Valeria's entire city was reduced to rubble.
A huge tsunami caused by the earthquake afterward hit the Chilean coastline, causing a tsunami wave with a height of 25 meters.
Tsunami waves reached distant Japan and the Philippines.
The number of casualties and economic losses caused by such a disaster cannot be accurately known.
Over the past 60 years, the most destructive earthquakes to have occurred globally
The Alaska earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, and it was also the day of Jesus' crucifixion.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history occurred in Alaska, USA, with a magnitude of 9.2 on the Richter scale.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake remained the third largest earthquake ever recorded in the world.
During an earthquake, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate near the Academy Canyon in Williamson Canyon broke off.
In most areas, the earthquake lasted for three to five minutes.
A large tsunami was triggered by the seafloor shift, reaching a height of 67 meters.
Because it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake ultimately resulted in the deaths of 139 people.
Of the 9 people who died directly from the earthquake, 130 died from the tsunami caused by the earthquake.
Over the past 60 years, the most destructive earthquakes worldwide have occurred.
The Tangshan Earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred within 16 hours in Tangshan City and Fengnan County in Hebei Province, China.
The epicenter is 23 kilometers from the surface.
All traffic, communications, water and electricity services were interrupted in Tianjin City, and they were levelled in an instant.
The capital Beijing, located 140 kilometers away, also felt strong earthquake tremors.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, all the affected areas, earthquakes killed 242,769 people and injured 164,851.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second-most deadly earthquake in China to date, after the 1556 earthquake in the reign of Emperor Jiajing.
However, some overseas scientists have estimated that this earthquake could cause at least 650,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquakes to have occurred globally over the past 60 years
The Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred on the western coast of Aceh province in Indonesia's Sumatra island, 160 km from the epicenter, with a depth of 30 km and a magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
A tsunami with a height of 15 to 30 meters was caused by the earthquake.

The Pacific coast of 14 countries was affected, including the most severely affected areas, which include Aceh in Indonesia, Thailand's Phuket and Pattaya tourist districts, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

At that time, it was the peak season for Christmas travel, and the affected areas had gathered a large number of tourists and local residents, which led to many tourists enjoying their holidays on the beach and local people working on the beach being swept away by the tsunami, which made many people missing.
It is estimated that the number of the dead and the number of the missing is at least 300,000 people.
Over the past 60 years, the most destructive earthquakes to occur globally
Earthquake in Wenchuan (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake struck the Wenchuan area in Sichuan Province in China.

According to data from the China Earthquake Administration, the intensity of the surface waves of this earthquake reached 8.2, and the intensity of the vertical waves reached 8.3. The affected area exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had claimed the lives of 69,227 people, 17,923 were missing, 374,643 were injured to varying degrees, 1,993.03 million people lost their homes, and the total population affected was 46,25.6 million.
It was the most destructive earthquake in the People's Republic of China since its establishment, and also the most devastating one after the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Day each year, and that efforts would be made to strengthen education of the public and attention to disaster prevention and mitigation work.
Since then, governments and schools in many Chinese cities and counties have held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and secondary schools have also begun to pay attention to the popularization of "earthquake prevention and disaster reduction" education.
Over the past 60 years, the most destructive earthquakes to have occurred worldwide
The Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, the Caribbean island of Haiti experienced an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0.
The epicenter is located 25 kilometers southwest of the capital of Haiti, Port-au-Prince, and the hypocenter is located about 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Red Cross estimates that the population affected by the earthquake is about 3 million.
The number of confirmed deaths announced by the Haitian government exceeded 200,000.
In some areas in Haiti, up to 90% of the houses were destroyed by the earthquake.

Although the international community has provided a great deal of assistance and support, this country, which is overpopulated and plagued by corruption and poverty, has never recovered from the disaster.
Over the past 60 years, the most destructive earthquakes worldwide have occurred.
The 2011 Tohoku earthquake in Japan's northeast region
On March 11, 2011, a large earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 occurred in the offshore area of the Tohoku region of Japan's northeast.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean, east of Sendai City, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the source depth was measured at 24 km. A tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 m was triggered.
This earthquake was the first of its magnitude over 9 recorded in Japan since there was seismic monitoring there.
Approximately 22,000 people lost their lives in the disaster, and about 4 million buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant was affected by an earthquake tsunami and suffered a leakage accident.
This accident has been classified as the most serious on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES) at level 7.
The Fukushima nuclear disaster has resulted in the widespread detection of trace radioactive substances, including iodine-131 and cesium-137 (half-lives of 30 years) around the world.
Massive amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific as a result of this nuclear accident.
According to UN statistics, in the disaster zones of Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan, at least 870,000 people are in urgent need of food.
Just in Syria alone, there are over 5.3 million people who have lost their homes due to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) called for funding of $77 million to provide food for the millions of refugees from Turkey and Syria who have been displaced by earthquakes.
The current temperature in the disaster area is as low as -10°C, and many victims do not have a place to stay.
The Turkish government has distributed large amounts of hot meals, tents, and blankets, but these materials are still difficult to deliver to many people who urgently need help.
In Syria, which has been embroiled in civil war for 12 years, the earthquake only added to the misery of the people.
Within four days of the earthquake, the World Food Programme had provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for the treatment of trauma and emergency surgery.
(Reuters, Thomson Reuters, etc.)

NEWS GOV-MO: Crime Alert: The Police Force Urges the Public to Be Aware of Fraudulent Short Messages from Fake Telecommunications Companies

Recently, the police force received multiple cases of telecommunications fraud. The perpetrators impersonated the telecommunications company of Macao and sent fraudulent SMS messages to victims that included links to websites. They used the fact that the rewards for accumulated points were due to be redeemed as bait to trick victims into logging into fake websites to redeem the rewards.

The victim entered the credit card details and verification code as instructed, and received a notification from the financial institution that an unknown purchase record appeared on the credit card. He suspected that the credit card details had been stolen through the above website.
It has been confirmed that the relevant telecommunications companies did not send the above-mentioned short messages.

The Police Force appealed to the public to be alert if they receive similar SMS messages, and not to enter the links contained in the SMS messages or provide any personal information; if they are asked to provide credit card information, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, they should be doubly careful, to prevent their credit cards from being stolen and used fraudulently.
Anti-fraud alert:
1. Pay more attention to information about network security, and improve personal awareness of self-defense;
2. Do not log in to websites with unknown origins and register your personal and credit card information on the website, as this may be stolen;
3. Be on the lookout for fake websites and phishing websites, and always pay attention to whether the website URL is completely consistent with the official website;
Install antivirus software on your mobile phone, tablet, or computer and keep it updated regularly;

If you suspect you have been scammed or have committed other crimes, you should immediately call the Anti-Scam Hotline of the Police Bureau at 8800 7777 or the Crime Reporting Hotline at 993 for help.
