Google's AI chatbot "answered the wrong question" and its parent company's stock price evaporated to the tune of $10 billion.
(Combined on the 11th)

Google's newly launched AI chatbot Bard is off to a bad start, as it "got the answer wrong" in the promotional video, causing Alphabet's parent company's stock to plummet by 8.9% on Thursday, falling below the $100 mark and losing $110 billion in market value (about RM47.65 billion), as of the closing of the market on Friday. The stock closed
The market is concerned that Alphabet will not be able to compete with its competitor Microsoft.

According to a report by Reuters, Google earlier released a promotional video on social media for its AI chatbot Bard, in which someone asks Bard: "What are some of the new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) that I can tell my 9-year-old child about?"
Bard mentioned in his answer that this telescope had taken the first photo of an exoplanet outside the solar system.

However, according to data from the United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photograph of an extrasolar planet was taken by the Very Large Telescope of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
"Bard's Answer to a Wrong Answer Causes Alphabet Stock to Tumble" was the headline in Reuters.

On the other hand, Google points out that Bard's response "demonstrates the importance of a rigorous testing process," and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's responses "meet high standards for quality, safety, and truthfulness."
The tourism industry in Singapore is recovering strongly, with the number of inbound tourists increasing by 19 times compared to 2021.

(Combined on November 11) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that the number of international visitors expected to visit Singapore in 2023 could reach 12 to 14 million, which will generate tourism revenue of about 18 to 21 billion Singapore dollars. The number of international visitors and tourism revenue are expected to recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic
The Singapore tourism market is gradually reopening and recovering in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of incoming visitors in 2022 increased by 19 times compared to 2021, reaching 6.3 million, surpassing the earlier forecast of 4 to 6 million people. Visitors have already recovered to the 33% level of pre-pandemic times.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion new dollars, and it is estimated that the tourism revenue for the entire year of 2022 will reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion new dollars, which is 6 times to 7 times more than in 2021 (1.89 billion new dollars). This has already recovered to about 5
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced funding of nearly 5 billion new dollars to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.

The Tourism Bureau recently announced that it will allocate 1.1 billion new dollars from this budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to the area.

To make health and wellness a highlight of Singapore's tourism, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an expression of interest exercise on November 23, 2022 to develop a health and wellness destination in the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, the Executive Director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have placed their health and well-being at the top of their considerations when planning their trips.

Developing a health resort in the southern coastal region of the Marina Bay, which includes the Marina Bay Gardens and the Marina Bay Promenade, is expected to contribute to the tourism industry and economy of Singapore, thereby allowing tourists to spend more time in Singapore and stay longer.
Chen Jianlong, Director of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in the coming few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness projects to the local public and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 types of health activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer tourists new travel experiences.

In addition to the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, Universal Studios' AVATAR World at Sentosa Cove, the new "Discover New Frontiers" exhibition hall at the ArtScience Museum, and the outdoor theater built at the new night safari, the Tourism Board will support the development and upgrading of projects such as the Wildlife Park at Jurong Bird Park and make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate relevant industry standards for the conference, exhibition and incentive tourism sectors related to sustainable development by the end of 2023, and will focus on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions issues in two major areas to further optimize the tourism environment.
The recovery of the Singapore tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, passenger traffic at Changi Airport has recovered strongly, with over 150,000 passengers served per day, and approximately 10 million passengers served per week, which is about 75% of the pre-epidemic level. The number of airline staff in service has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-epidemic level.
Data shows that in the first 10 months of 2022, Singapore has welcomed 23.6 million visitors, equivalent to 42% of pre-pandemic levels, with 1.7 million flights, which is 53% of pre-pandemic levels.
Travel is quickly recovering, and this is also boosting the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, dining and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

Xu Shutan, Assistant Director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that a survey by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore's safety index ranked third in the world, which is one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 epidemic, about 3.6 million people traveled to Singapore for vacation each year.
With China's border policy being relaxed, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists this year will recover to 30% to 60% of the number in 2019.

Koo Suet-Dann pointed out that the Tourism Board will closely monitor signals from China regarding the further relaxation of policies for outbound travel, in order to meet the changing needs of tourists.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists to destinations outside of China to meet the new trends in this market.

The Singapore Tourism Board is confident about the travel market in 2023, believing that the global economy will not experience a significant decline that affects public income, and that there will be no new large-scale lethal epidemics that break out, and that the travel industry will recover more quickly than expected.

The E-Account for Funds has Arrived: The SFC Authorizes the Realization of Concentration and Query for All Funds Held by Investors - Economic Observer - Professional Financial News Website
Reporter Chen Xin of Economic Observer reports that the complicated channels of fund purchase make it difficult to collect account information.
Do you always forget the "little treasure chest"?
The problems of the citizens will soon be resolved.
On February 10, the SFC announced that the "E Fund Account" APP had been uploaded to various mobile application stores and was in the process of open trial operation.

According to the introduction, the "Fund E Account" provides "one-stop" inquiry services for publicly-traded fund accounts and shareholding information to individual investors, and is intended to solve the pain points of the industry, such as forgetting account information and complicated procedures.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 domestic public fund management companies in total, managing fund assets of about RMB2.6 trillion; and there were 167 fund registration agencies for public funds, and 411 sales agencies for public funds.
Each registration entity has an independent accounting system, and there is no centralized query channel for the industry.
Industry insiders say that at the end of 2021, China's fund investors exceeded 720 million people, which means that half of the country's population invested in fund products.

Investors previously had to inquire about their purchases from different sales organizations, but through the "Fund E Account," they can check the purchase status from all sales channels, and the holdings of funds are clear at a glance.
What is the "E-Fund Account" app?

According to relevant documents, the "ETF Account App" is a mobile application developed and constructed by China Clearing under the approval of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide one-stop query services for investors regarding the off-exchange holdings of all public fund products in the market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly monitor their holdings of fund products of various fund managers through the "Fund E Account" across the various sales channels in the market, and thus greatly enhance the query efficiency.

Specifically, investors can check the information available through the "Fund E Account" as follows: information about fund accounts opened at the management companies of all publicly-traded funds in the market, information about trading accounts opened at the sales agencies of publicly-traded fund products, and information about the holdings of off-exchange fund shares, including publicly-traded securities investment funds and investment funds established by securities companies that are not subject

Liu Yicheng, head of business development at Shanghai Stock Fund Evaluation Research Center, told Economic Observer reporter that investors can learn about their holdings in all off-exchange public funds through the "Fund E Account" App, helping them recover their "forgotten assets", and more importantly, the App has helped clients to consolidate comprehensive information about their fund investments into a single account, which has helped them to better and more
How do I register to use?

Reporters noted that currently, the "Fund E Account" APP has been uploaded to the mobile application stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and vivo, but the APP is still in the public trial phase, and investors must enter an invitation code to register. Investors can contact the fund management company that holds the fund to obtain it.

A customer service staff member at a large publicly traded fund in Shanghai provided Economic Observer with a 6-digit invitation code and told the reporter, "In the APP test phase, China Clearing provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager. Investors can call to get them. We will provide them all."
After the trial operation is completed, users no longer need invitation codes to register.

Reporters registered and used the "Fund E Account" based on the related documents published on the official website of the SFC, and completed the search within a few minutes. The whole process consisted of four steps: user registration, real name verification, fund account binding, and public fund search.

After verifying the identity, click the "Funds" button to bind the fund to the account, and all funds purchased by the reporter through various fund sales platforms will appear in the binding option list (can bind the account). After binding, you can easily see the total assets of the invested funds and start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the "Fund E account" only provides investors with query services, but cannot be used for redemption and buying and selling.
The data displayed in the E fund account generally advances three trading days from the date of the user's query (T day).

For example, the total assets, fund shares, and fund net asset value displayed on the Assets page of the Fund E account on February 10 correspond to the dates three business days prior to that date, i.e., February 7.

The labor union again organized a large-scale anti-government retirement reform protest march.

On Saturday (February 11), French trade unions once again called for a nationwide mobilization to protest against the government's pension reform plan, calling on citizens to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth day of social movement for the opposition to the government's pension reform proposal.
How many people respond to the call for a demonstration may affect the next actions of the trade union organizations.

This is the fourth time in a month that the eight major French trade unions have collectively called for a nationwide mobilization, and it is the first time that this protest activity has been scheduled for Saturday.

Given that for most French people Saturday is a day off, they do not need to choose between participating in protests and going on strike, so trade unions are hoping that today's gathering activities will attract more people to

The transit system's subway, as well as the unions of public rail companies, have not called for a strike today, and the transit system should be able to operate normally, and citizens can use public transportation to reach the gathering locations, and in the areas where schools are starting their winter breaks, people can travel normally on vacation.

Trade union groups hope that today will see more than one million people attend the rally, while the police expect the total number of participants nationwide to be between 600,000 and 800,000. In Paris, between 90,000 and 120,000 people may gather in the city centre.

Since the beginning of the protest movement against the pension reform plan, which would delay the mandatory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, opinion polls have shown that most French people do not support the measure, but the number of people who actually go out on the streets to participate in the marches is gradually decreasing.
The first strike demonstration on January 31 gathered 1.27 million to 2.5 million people nationwide.
The protesting crowd has shrunk to between 7.57 million and 20 million people nationwide by this Tuesday (February 7).
The pension reform proposal is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition parties, particularly those led by the opposition parties, there were numerous amendment proposals submitted, which slowed down the process of debate considerably.
The disputes between the two parties also become more intense and acrimonious.
A left-wing radical party, France Insoumise, recently posted a photo of a balloon with the head of the Minister of Labor on social media, which caused the ruling party to protest.
The chairman of the National Assembly finally announced a 15-day ban on the activities of this member of the National Assembly, as a punishment for such behavior.

Although this reform proposal has triggered the largest social upheaval in France over the past 20 years, to date the government has made only minor adjustments to the draft, but has not made any major concessions.

The union has already planned to launch another action next week, on Thursday, March 16th, when the reform bill was submitted to the Senate for discussion. The union also plans to organize protest actions on the 7th of March, when the reform bill was submitted to the Senate for discussion.

The last communist prime minister of East Germany died recently.
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "Yesterday, Hans Modrow left us, aged 95.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened after 28 years of dividing East Berlin and West Berlin, Mdvro said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At the time, the Communist Party leaders were forced to step down due to the demands of protesters for democracy and freedom throughout East Germany.
After Gorbachev took power in the Soviet Union, he demanded reform in the Eastern Bloc, which was under Soviet control.
In March 1990, Mdró announced the first and only free elections in the GDR.
He is no longer Prime Minister due to the election results.
Although Mudro tried to reform the country, his opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and unification that occurred in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modero was found guilty of election fraud in the 1989 Mayoral election, but did not serve jail time.
These accusations are said to be politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament, and from 1999 to 2004 he was a member of the European Parliament.
Modro considers himself a reformer and hopes to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want the old East Germany to return, but said that the achievements of East Germany should be acknowledged.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and received training as a machinist.

During World War II, he served as the squad leader of the Youth Fire Brigade and became a member of the Volkssturm organization, which called on men aged 16 to 60 to participate in the final struggle of the war.
At the age of 17, Modrow was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he attended anti-fascist courses and became a firm Communist Party member.
In the year that East Germany was founded, 1949, after returning home, he found a job as a mechanical engineer and continued his studies in social sciences and economics, earning a doctorate.

Mordor was a worker in the Free German Youth Movement, and almost all East German youths joined the movement. During the period from 1973 to 1989, he rose to become the head of the SED party in the Dresden region.
He also served as a member of the parliament in East Germany for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany and held the highest state office.

Does the balloon incident make America see more clearly?
Strengthen the restriction of technology exports to China
According to a report by the Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten the export of technology to China after the balloon incident.

Current and former security officials have stated that the above balloon incident highlighted the security threats posed by China, and that this would help to gain more political support for enhancing US technology protection.
The United States claims that the balloon carried antennas and sensors used for intelligence gathering and communication.
According to Martijn Rasser, a senior official at the former US Central Intelligence Agency and currently serving at the New America Security Center in Washington, D.C., this is what he said.
"This is undoubtedly pouring fuel on the fire, and supports the view of the hardliners on China."

White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said to reporters on Thursday, "We will also consider taking more comprehensive action to expose and counter China's larger-scale surveillance activities that pose a threat to our national security and to our allies and partners.

U.S. officials said that they have reported the circumstances of the balloon incident to governments in over 30 countries, and international coordination is critical in addressing the threat from China.

Senior researcher Emily Benso at the Center for Strategic and International Studies said, in addition to the actions taken by the Biden administration, the newly established US-China Strategic Competition Subcommittee of the US House of Representatives may also exert pressure on the US to adopt more stringent measures to slow down China's development.
She said that members of Congress will feel increasing pressure to take a more strident stance, which could force the White House to adopt a more strident policy.
The Wall Street Journal reports that many advocates of stricter export controls are also pushing for the expansion of the control list to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The US government is also currently developing a plan for a foreign investment review that will examine whether potential national security threats from China exist in the US's overseas investments.
Analysts say the White House may face calls to speed up the implementation of the plan.

Since the strong earthquake hit Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working tirelessly in the ruins of thousands of damaged buildings, rescuing survivors trapped under rubble.
In the cold temperature, they often urge to keep quiet, because they are trying their best to hear any sound of life from the old and crumbling concrete piles.

The earthquake that occurred on Monday, with a magnitude of 7.8, triggered several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, making it the seventh most deadly natural disaster of this century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan, and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by the 2003 earthquake in neighboring Iran.
In 1999, a similar strong earthquake occurred in the northwest of Turkey and caused the deaths of more than 17,000 people.

Two women were trapped for 122 hours in the region where the deadliest earthquake in 20 years occurred, and rescuers from Turkey pulled the two women out from the rubble of collapsed buildings, the Turkish authorities said on Saturday.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was confirmed to have been rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in the largest city in southeastern Turkey, Diyarbakir.
In the cold temperature, rescuers often urge people to remain quiet, because they are trying their best to hear any signs of life from the crumbling concrete piles.
In the Samandag district of Turkey, rescue workers crouched under concrete slabs and quietly said "Inshallah"—"God willing"—as they carefully reached into the rubble to rescue a 10-day-old infant.
He opened his eyes wide and the baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a heating blanket and carried to the field hospital.
The video image shows that the emergency personnel also took away his mother. She was dizzy and pale, with a bluish face, but was conscious.
Turkey's Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters that in the past 24 hours, 67 people were rescued from the rubble, and a total of 31,000 rescue personnel were deployed in the affected areas.
He said that about 80,000 people are receiving treatment in the hospital, and 1.05 million people have become homeless due to the earthquake and are living in makeshift shelters.
Because many people lack food in the cold winter conditions, the public is increasingly questioning the reactions of the leaders of the two countries to the rescue.
According to official Syrian media, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, where they are said to have been for the first time since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said that due to the complex nature of relief work in the war-torn Syrian northwest controlled by the rebels, its stocks in that region were about to run out.
On Friday, Erdoğan visited Turkey's Adana province and admitted that the government's response had not met the expected speed.
Opponents seized on this issue to attack Erdogan, who will run for re-election on May 14, but the disaster may delay the vote.
Reuters reports that the anger over the delay in providing assistance and initiating rescue operations may affect the elections.
Even before the earthquake, voting was considered the most serious challenge to Erdogan's rule since he came to power twenty years ago.
Erdogan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative activities for political interests."
The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, criticized the government's response.
Critics say, "The earthquake was very large, but the most serious thing about it is the lack of coordination, the lack of planning, and the incompetence.

VNA Hanoi— According to a report by the Vietnam News Agency, during the visit to Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, abbreviated as "Brunei University") on February 11, 2022 morning.
Brunei University is the largest higher education and scientific research center in Brunei, and is ranked third in the university rankings for this region.
VUB is one of the symbols of the educational and training cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.
The University of Brunei Darussalam officially established a partnership with Vietnam's FPT University in July 2013 in the field of English language training.
Besides English, French, German, Japanese and Korean, Vietnamese is also included in the course curriculum at Universiti Brunei Darussalam.
When visiting the University of Brunei, the Prime Minister of Vietnam Pham Minh Chinh and his wife spoke with the students of the Vietnamese language class.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chinh is pleased to see more and more foreigners like learning Vietnamese, and this has motivated him to make a positive contribution to the promotion of Vietnamese culture and local customs to the world.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chien expressed the belief that the Vietnamese teaching team at the University of Brunei Darussalam would become stronger; and that the students of the Vietnamese language class would become more interested in Vietnamese, and would strive to learn it well and be able to use it fluently as soon as possible, and become the ambassadors of the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Brunei Darussalam.

While taking advantage of the opportunity, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also exchanged views with Vietnamese students who are currently learning English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Can Tho via video, to learn about their study situation, especially during the pandemic.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh believes that the cooperation between FPT University in Vietnam and UBD University in Brunei, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, is a vivid symbol of the educational cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.
At the same time, we hope that the students at this center will make greater progress in their studies and contribute positively to the friendly cooperation between Vietnam and Laos.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chinh highly praised the results of educational cooperation between the two countries during his discussions with the Minister of Education of Brunei and the leaders of the University of Brunei Darussalam, including the cooperation between FPT University and the University of Brunei Darussalam, and the decision to include Vietnamese in the course curriculum at the University of Brunei Darussalam.
Prime Minister Phan Minh Chien hopes that VNU will continue to focus on ensuring the quality of Vietnamese language teaching and further expand the size of the Vietnamese language classes.

The Prime Minister of Vietnam, Phan Minh Chiến, also highly evaluated the positive effects achieved by the two countries in cooperation based on the Educational Cooperation Memorandum of Understanding signed in April 2014; he recommended that Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively implement short-term exchange programs such as the Global Discovery Programme, the Discovery Year, etc.

Prime Minister Pahn Minseng highly praised the establishment of the first Vietnamese branch of the University of Brunei Darussalam in Vietnam; he believes that the university will continue to grow in terms of its regional and global development; and he hopes to further strengthen cooperation with Vietnamese higher education institutions.
In this opportunity, Prime Minister Pannam and his wife planted a tree in the campus of the University of Brunei Darussalam and wrote messages in the guestbook.

Prime Minister Pannamjay congratulated the University of Brunei Darussalam on its continued progress and the increasing contribution it makes to Brunei's education sector, and on its increasingly deep and wide-ranging cooperation with Vietnamese educational and training institutions.
(End)

What was the "object" that fell from the sky over Alaska?
Confusing and mysterious, speculation abounds.
The US military again used the US's most advanced stealth fighter jet, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the air over Alaska on Friday afternoon (February 10).
The location where the plane was shot down is ten miles from the Alaskan coast.
This is the second time in less than a week that US forces have shot down an airborne object.
A Chinese spy balloon drifted over the United States for several days before being destroyed over the coastal area of South Carolina on Saturday.

The Pentagon said that the second object that was shot down entered U.S. airspace for the first time on Thursday evening and was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved over the skies of Alaska's northeast, at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, and much smaller than the previously shot down Chinese spy balloon.
The Pentagon also believes that there are no indications that this object is controllable.

John Kirby, strategic communications coordinator for the White House National Security Council, said on Friday that although the details of the object flying in the high altitude were not clear, it "constituted a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aircraft."
Kobe said that this object is different from the spy balloon found in the United States. It does not have a banner with the word "effective payload" hanging from it.
"We call it a 'thing' right now, and that's the best description we can give of it," Kobe said.
President Biden received the advice of the Pentagon before issuing the order to shoot down the object, and he made his decision "very carefully," Coburn added.

The official description of this object from the US government can be roughly summarized as: it is about the size of a small car, it has no control panel, it has no suspension system, and its flying altitude is about 10,000 meters.
However, these pieces of information cannot answer basic questions, such as what this object is and which country it belongs to, and what tasks it is performing.
Currently, there are many analyses and guesses online that suggest that this may be another Chinese balloon.

It may have come from the same Chinese balloon that invaded American airspace, or the Chinese balloon that was floating over South America, and they may have been carrying out some kind of mission at different locations.
Some people also associate the "object" in Alaska with "unidentified flying objects" (UFOs).

According to a report in the Weekly Standard, citing a tweet posted by former US Congressman Peter Meijer on Friday, "I really hope that this unidentified flying object is a spy balloon, not a legitimate UFO."
The satire of confusing alien spacecraft with weather balloons is surprisingly effective, but it's not worth sparking a galactic conflict, Maje said.
Ms. Maye was posting this tweet shortly after Kobe confirmed the fall of the object in Alaska.
According to Weekly News, more than just Maje suspects that this object is an UFO.

Tennessee Republican Congressman Tim Burchett criticized the government's cover-up of intelligence last month, demanding the Director of National Intelligence Office (DNI) release a report on "unidentified flying objects."

It is not recommended to read it.
I read it a long time ago, and just happened to see a review of it on memory.
This book is not a short story collection, but rather a collection of fragments from everyday life about love.

The tone of the book is extremely flat, it's the kind of flatness that is like white water, the use of words and phrases is perfect for minimalism, and the plot is as calm and quiet as the streets in the afternoon of a summer day.
Every short story is a fragment of time from everyday life, without a beginning or an end.
They are collected together under the title "When We Talk About Love, What Are We Talking About?"

I think this short story collection, and its title, are a form of behavioral art. The author is trying to express that love is not limited to the ups and downs of life on the stage, the legendary sea and the desert, or the sticky-sweetness of love. Love is not limited to the above, and it should not be represented by the above. Love is also a boring, everyday life. It is a life that is devoid of flav
While reading this book, you may recall your neighbor's quarreling couple, your acquaintances' stale marriages, and the unpleasant feelings of your relationships.

This is exactly why I do not recommend reading it: from an aesthetic point of view, the book's style and plot are bland and boring, unless you are living a turbulent life or your life is like living in a castle of sweets. Otherwise, you will feel that the book is weird and boring to read.

From a philosophical perspective, everyday events do not make one's eyes light up or broaden one's perspective (unlike in Marquez's Love in the Time of Cholera), and brief segments do not discuss any issues, such as what mistakes lead to the failure of love?
What are the reasons for the breakup of the main character's marriage?
Therefore, I do not recommend reading this book. It does not matter whether or not you read it.
The author's ideas are expressed more through technique and style than through the plot, which is one of the reasons why the reading experience of this book is inferior.
Suitable for quick reading, but not for close examination.
This book is logically sound, but its content is not enough.
They explain what many sales theories are about and why, but they are weak in terms of how to do it, just pointing out the direction but not giving specific methods.
This book also feels like it was compiled.
There are both domestic and foreign examples; there are both famous entrepreneurs or salespeople and unknown people who are not well known.
Whether this story was compiled as an example is not known. If some cases the author experienced were used, it would be more convincing.
The customer-client designation goes back and forth in terms.
In the title, the customer is still the customer, but in the main text, the customer becomes the client.
There were also problems with missing punctuation marks, misplaced numbers, and erroneous page numbers in the electronic book.
In short, this book is a good choice as an introduction to theory, but it is not very suitable for people who are already engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales performance.
A quick introduction to Internet finance

This book is quite shallow, and can be said to be an introduction course. It can help everyone quickly understand the full picture of Internet finance, but to understand it in depth, one still needs to dig in by oneself.

Moreover, the book was written earlier, and the later content of the WeChat and Weibo subsidies to promote user habits has not been mentioned. Today, the third-party payment share is probably not as small as the proportion mentioned in the book, right?
Nowadays, many people go out to eat and just bring their phones with them. And because of the high bank balance due to the use of UnionPay, many merchants have abandoned it.

But I am still very grateful to the author for writing this beginner's book. It is clear that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the development history of both domestic and foreign finance. This is why the content is so easy to understand.
Writing in a high, wide space is easy, but it's difficult to write in a way that is understandable to everyone.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know!
The first factor determining a person's job satisfaction is not the amount of pay, but whether they feel sufficiently appreciated and valued in their work.

According to Maslow's theory of the hierarchy of needs, after the basic needs for survival have been met, the most urgent need is for the fulfillment of psychological needs - the desire to be understood, recognized, and appreciated.
Indeed, for most Chinese people, it is "hard to say I love you from the heart," even when they feel love, gratitude, and praise. They keep these feelings to themselves and don't express them.
The author explains five languages of praise in this book: positive words, thoughtful gestures, service, thoughtful gifts, and physical contact.

I think the important thing is not so much that you know what the five languages of praise are, but that you can spontaneously and genuinely use these five languages to praise and thank the people around you, whether they are family, friends, or colleagues.
In fact, the more intimate the relationship, the more praise and gratitude we need. Only then will our lives become more beautiful.
Businesses can also retain talent to a certain extent by praising them. This will also help reduce the rate of resignations.
We are grateful to translators for bringing us the interesting ideas and worlds from foreign countries.

Due to cultural differences between the West and the East, and other reasons, there may be some differences between the languages, and if you have the opportunity to read the original text, I believe you will gain more.
Thanks again to the authors and translators, and to the editors for their hard work!
